ygData.subject: Re: Lullaby
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Yeah, Goatanos song analysis was wrong on this point.  I ve successfully nodded (i.e. survived) 12 at once.  I ve unsuccessfully done 15 trying to hold
ygData.messageBody:
On Mon, 1 Nov 1999, Jeff Illian wrote:
>
> Anyone have any recent experience with lullaby? I was looking at the song
> analysis and it indicated that lullaby didn't effect more then 4 targets.
> About a week back my party got ambushed in East Karana by a bunch of spirit
> stalkers while my party was engaging undead reavers (3 of them). I struck
> up lullaby with my lute and sure enough, I got 10 head nods messages (7
> stalkers and all 3 undead reavers). There was so much chaos so I'm not sure
> if it took or not, but it at least allowed us enough freedom to dispatch of
> the gnolls and then eventually the stalkers. I definitely felt like more
> then 4 were really sleeping...

Yeah, Goatanos' song analysis was wrong on this point. I've
successfully nodded (i.e. survived) 12 at once. I've
unsuccessfully done 15 trying to hold them so my party could
get away. It definitely takes as my party ran off with only 3
or 4 mobs chasing them, the other 11 or 12 stayed around with
me.

There *is* a limit of 4 mobs that can be attacking you at any
one time (might've been lowered to 3, didn't really watch
closely this weekend). If more than 4 aggro on you, the rest
will just ignore you until one of the original 4 dies. So if
you're using an AE song, it can seem like it's only affecting
4 at a time. Just position yourself better so everything is
affected.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
